website_summaries.verdict: The best pick if you're looking for a super-rugged cooler, although some felt that it wasn't worth the price tag.
pros: Features blow-molded construction, a reinforced base, stainless steel hardware, and rubberized T-grip latches
Extra thick insulation allows for 5 days of ice retention at 90-degrees
Super solid, and you can sit on it
cons: Some felt that this cooler was overpriced for what it does
Some buyers did their own ice test and report that this cooler only holds ice for about 1 to 2 days

customer_reviews.title: We are always seeing which one performs better with ice rentention in the field while we work
customer_reviews.text: I am a die hard Pelican fan. My friend a yeti fan. We are always seeing which one performs better with ice rentention in the field while we work. Honestly they are very close. Those come at a high cost. This Igloo BMX cooler is doing just as good as my Pelican at a fraction of the cost. It’s a little lighter the handle and straps seem to be heavy duty. It’s got a great look and works just the same ! Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weekender for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have not put this IGLOO BMX cooler to the test in the sun outdoors (its still winter here in VT) but I did an indoor test and a 10 lb bag of ice lasted three days, at least a day longer than my Rubbermaid cooler (see photos) which has similar capacity. I gave it 4 stars as I was expecting better performance from the BMX, and it might benefit from a rubber lid seal which it lacks. At 10.2 lbs the BMX is significantly heavier than the Rubbermaid at 4.6 lbs, but less than the Yeti Roadie 20 at 15 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McGill

customer_reviews.title: Cool as ice!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler! I wanted the yeti at first, and then checked out other high valued coolers and eventually found this igloo one at a steal of a price. Ice lasted 5 days!!! Could go longer! Of course it melted somewhat but after drawing the water I was left with a good amount of ice leftover after 5 days! Super happy with this cooler, and I highly recommend it!!! Save some money and buy this cooler, you won’t regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaycode415

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with how this cooler performed
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I took this cooler camping Saturday night. I put two bags of 5 lbs ice in it and then put in the beer. We opened multiple times to get out either a beer or ice for a drink. Came home Sunday afternoon and took the beer out and put in a refrigerator. I didn't lock down the lid. it is now Tuesday night. Checked tonight and there is still ice in the cooler. I am very satisfied with how this cooler performed.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but I'm concerned about long term quality.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it looks and feels (feels solid and durable), and it worked well on a 4-day/3-night trip to the Lodgepole area, but the caps on the ends of the handles came off (lost) which allows the metal bar that holds the handle together to fall out. Now I have to find out how to order new end caps.
customer_reviews.author: D. DUBE

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Solid alternative to the more expensive Yeti/RTIC options. Pros: -very solid construction -lid is rigid enough to be used as a seat -latches lock the lid down tight -looks great Cons: -less usable space (compared to overall size) due to the heavy duty wall thickness -latches sometimes hang down and get in the way when you're trying to close the cooler -the handle flexes a little when you pick up the fully loaded cooler...it doesn't seem like a bad thing, just pointing it out
customer_reviews.author: Eric R

customer_reviews.title: Keeps ice for over 4 days.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Igloo as my hunting cooler so it stays in the back of my truck. It's been 4 days and I still have about 75% of my ice. It's rugged, lockable and keeps everything cool. In my opinion, just as good as a Yeti at a quarter of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Not made in the USA?
customer_reviews.text: So many igloo coolers made in America, yet it is ironic that the expensive one is made in China...
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Light abd well insulated
customer_reviews.text: I put a 30 pack of water bottles in this which was about 70°F and a 20lb bag of ice. The cooler stayed in the bed of my black truck on a black rubber mat in the heat of Texas and Oklahoma. 5 days later there were 6 bottles of water in it and still ice floating around. I'm happy with it. It is a great cooler and I've got zero bad things to say about it so far
customer_reviews.author: C.Burms

customer_reviews.title: Makes water
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome water maker. Just add ice and in three hours you will have nice cold water. Open the valve on the side to pour the water into a cup. It's the best. I dont recommend putting any drinks or food in the water maker because they will not stay cold. It looks really cool and all my friends think I got a great deal. If you are looking for a water maker this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Husband purchased this to put on his work truck for water and other drinks. Has raved about this repeatedly. Ice was still in it after 3 days, water still ice cold days after that, while sitting in 90+ degree, direct sunlight. He’s very happy when this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HTinGA

customer_reviews.title: Pray you get a good cooler from a good batch.
customer_reviews.text: I keep this cooler in the cab of my truck. Never leaves it. Well, it fell apart after 35 days. I went to bring it inside for hurricane Dorian. Literally fell apart. See photos attached. Holds ice for 3-5 days. Depending on circumstances. I like the cooler but wish it lasted longer than a month.
customer_reviews.author: @93sr20det

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooler and well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is amazing. We had it 3/4 full of frozen foods, and topped it with 10 ice packs, and no regular ice. Two days later when opened, blast of cold air came out just like a freezer, and everything, including pancakes, were still frozen solid when we arrived at our destination. I have no doubt that it would have still been that way 5-7 days later. Handles are easy to grab and carry. It fit in both trunk and back seat of our Audi A6 Quattro, although there was not enough headspace to open the lid more than 6-7" once inside the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler for the money$$
customer_reviews.text: Keeps ice for several days! Heavyweight construction, real hinged lid . Great cooler. Comparable to a Yeti but a lot less expensive
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Not durrable.
customer_reviews.text: Screws on hinges came loose after 1 week of use. Not durrable! Used this for one week on a beach trip to Florida. Kept drinks cold but after getting home realized the hinges we're loose and stripping out the plastic they screw into. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight cooler
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good sized light weight cooler. It kept our meat frozen in the bottom half for two days but the food in the top half was starting to thaw. I’m sure we will get a lot of use out of it!
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: on first day leaked
customer_reviews.text: We had taken this cooler on a trip to another state. We felt that we would keep our soft drinks, juice and fruit cold while traveling. However, when the ice started melting this cooler became a disaster. It leaked and leaked and leaked. Water was everywhere. I would not recommend this product. It was returned.
customer_reviews.author: gradstudent

customer_reviews.title: If your an outdoorsman, this is your cooler!!
customer_reviews.text: One sweet cooler! Don’t plan on packing an entire weekend full of food with it, but great for a day trip or two. Mainly use this while riding my UTV with the family to keep lunch and drinks cold while out on the trails. Durable, super thick and truly keeps the ice for a long time! My family and I have beat the crap out of this thing since purchasing and hope for much more abuse to come.
customer_reviews.author: justin. k. howe

customer_reviews.title: Ice ice baby
customer_reviews.text: I would put this up against any high dollar cooler in a heartbeat. This was purchased for a hog hunt to bring home my meat, it kept everything ICE cold while I drove home and while I processed the meat. I would definitely recommend this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: No where near 5 day ice retention
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler specifically because of the claim of 5 day ice retention. Lucky if I even get 24 hours out of 5 gallons of ice.
customer_reviews.author: jason wade ellison

customer_reviews.title: Don't think I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Third time using hold down broke /// update contacted Igloo warranty 7/11/19 they are going to cover it we will see 7/23/19 Igloo warranty great received a new cooler today
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be just as good as other roto molded coolers I would recommend buying some window gasket and stick where I'm pointing with screw driver it holds ice as long as my Ozark trail and lifetime ( I refuse to spend 300-400 on a cooler) if you plan on strapping it down say on the rack on an ATV the strap can't go across inside of cooler because lid goes down inside of cooler strap has to run over top of cooler the cooler has spots on on the lid to run straps on all four corners but still can't open the top because strap holes are in lid
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great igloo
customer_reviews.text: Large cooler, kept everything cold with 2 bricks of dry ice and a 10 lb bag of ice for 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great! Keeps items cold.
customer_reviews.text: Love the cooler. The handles are hard and are easy to hold. The cooler is a great size and it has been amazing to use. I have no complaints, just wish I bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonjunkii

customer_reviews.title: Very solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, maybe even a bit too heavy. But it is very good looking. One star deducted specifically because all the Igloo coolers I have bought are made in America but this one is made in China. Really disappointed that they would build these coolers in China but their cheaper line of coolers in America.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT cooler. Ice lasted for 14 days. Very pleased with this item
customer_reviews.author: richard knight

customer_reviews.title: Loose Hinge Screw Problem Solved!! Great BMX Igloo Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this cooler and even though I read some reviews about people having problems with the hinge screws, I ordered it anyway. While I was waiting for the cooler to arrive, I ordered longer stainless steel screws for it along with some repurposed fire hose Igloo hinge replacement material from Amazon (see picture below). When the cooler arrived, I removed the hinges, drilled out the holes a little bit and hammered in the plastic wall anchors. I cut one of the replacement fire hose hinges in half, lined up the hinges and screwed in the longer screws. The screws are now extremely tight and the hinge works fine. You're welcome from this 63 year old lady, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Smart Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler to take on a road trip my husband and I took, we traveled 8500 miles in 68 days. It is well made and durable, I especially like the way it closes it has a tight seal. It kept our food and drinks cold and small ice cubes lasted a couple of days. We fit six small bottles of beer, six small bottles of coke, about 3 lbs of meat, a few fresh vegetables, a couple of candy bars and the ice to keep it all cold. Plenty of food to last a couple of days camping, but next time I will get a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: BEST COOLER HANDS DOWN
customer_reviews.text: COOLER IS SUPER STURDY AND DOES THE JOB. BOUGHT THIS FOR FATHER'S DAY AND DAD KEEPS THIS COOLER ALL DAY INSIDE HIS TRUCK (WE LIVE IN FLORIDA 90 TO 100 DEGREES RIGHT NOW DAILY) CONDITIONS INSIDE A CAR ARE HOTTER THAN OUTDOORS, SO BASICALLY THIS COOLER IS SITTING INSIDE THE TRUCK AT ABOUT 110-120 DEGREES ALL DAY LONG AND ICE DOES NOT MELT. COOLER CAN KEEP UP TO 4 DAYS AT A 90 DEGREE AMBIENT TEMP. BUT AT THE CONDITIONS INSIDE THAT TRUCK DOES A FANTASTIC JOB FOR SOLID 2-3 DAYS WITH ICE HOLDING ON STRONG! SUPER RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Superb cooler
customer_reviews.text: I took this out is the desert in extreme heat and blinding direct sun. This cooler shrugged off the blast furnace and held the ice like nothing I have ever seen. 24 hours later and the ice looked like I just put it in. No melting whatsoever. I have no doubt this will hold ice for days! Best cooler I ever owned. Built like an Abrams tank.
customer_reviews.author: Art Lange

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and doesn't keep cool all that well, is very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews better. This does not have a water tight seal when closed. Not sure how it expects to keep cool if water can just flow out in multiple places so easily. I bought it so my son could ice his foot after running after track/xc practice. It is the right size and I wanted to make sure it would keep ice in the trunk of his car through a school day. If it falls over when driving it'll leak all over and it only does a so-so job of keeping the ice. For the price I expected much more but it is too big to hassle with returning.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Macy

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler for the money. Better than your average cheap plastic cooler. Looks tough but not the same quality plastic and build as a Yeti or any one of the others. Do yourself a favor and buy some quarter inch foam insulation. The cooler doesn't come with any gasket or seal and it needs one. Quarter inch foam insulation fits perfectly inside the top's groove (see pictures). A rubber seal should have been added here from the factory.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed by this cooler for the price. When you read the description it says that the ice will last days. If your lucky and it’s not to hot you may get 24hrs with a couple cubes left over. When the ice melts and when your traveling the water splashes everywhere because there is no gasket between cover and cooler. There looks like there should be a gasket on the cover side due to the groove but definitely not impressed I would value this cooler at $29.99. Definitely gonna send it back.
customer_reviews.author: tim blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Cooler works just as well as Yeti for half the price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the Yeti coolers because they were large and heavy but had smaller interiors. I wanted their same latch capabilities. I didn't expect this cooler to work as well, but as long as it was close, I would be happy. I went on a weekend camping trip with this cooler and my friends all brought their Yeti's. This was a true test since all coolers were put through the same weekend with 90 degree weather. I was happy that this cooler retained ice just as well as the Yeti's.
customer_reviews.author: Afeather

customer_reviews.title: Not a 5 day cooler
customer_reviews.text: I have a $20 Coleman cooler and this new expensive Igloo. I filled both with ice and drinks Saturday night and by the following Tuesday all the ice in the igloo is gone. About half the ice in the Coleman is still there. Lesson learned! Three stars may be generous.
customer_reviews.author: K. Scott Wright

customer_reviews.title: I had to buy ice every day
customer_reviews.text: Went on a road trip for a week. We had sodas water beer and snacks. I was hot the first day when we packed the cooler so I wasn't really surprised when all the ice melted about 6 hours later. We drained the water and added 16 pounds of ice back to the cooler. The ice didn't last 24 hours. Had to purchase more ice. I really was excited about this purchase at first.....but I will have to return it due to its poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs weather strip, but great little cooler 👍
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews about this cooler and the bad ones mention that it doesn't seal and the hinge screws rip out. So when I first received it, prior to even using it I addressed those issues. I took a screw driver and removed the hinge screws and put apoxy between the cooler and the hinges and replaced the screws tightly. Then I put weather strip between the lid and the cooler. There's a perfect little groove where you can stick it (I put two strips) and it fits awesomely and seals very very well. As long as you're willing to do a little bit of work on it you'll have an awesome little cooler that performs like a yeti.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is great! When my family and I go to the lake or out to the country for a day it holds everything we need. It works the way the company says. I wouldn't try to sit on it though, not quite built for that. When we bring it inside the house the night before use it will hold the ice so much longer than if we left it in the hot garage before packing with food/drinks.
customer_reviews.author: FaLisha W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I traveled to Florida and needed and extra, heavy duty, ice chest, that could handle the heat, but not break my back (or pocket book) my my other heavy duty portable cooler. This cooler, is so much lighter with much more capacity. The number of days it held the ice was almost the same as the more expensive cooler, under near 100 degree temperatures. Under these conditions, the ice did not last five days, but it lasted well over two and that is saying something considering the amount of times I opened and closed it to put things in and take things out.
customer_reviews.author: John Bocade

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy. No cold retention at all.
customer_reviews.text: Filled with ice at about 5pm, opened up it up at ~9am the next morning and the ice was almost entirely all melted. The quality is nice, it's plastic but very heavy duty, sturdy handle, the lid closes nicely and holds tight. It's just a really poor seal, didnt keep ice for even 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Holds ice and fits great in my canoe got it in 2 days of ordering
customer_reviews.author: Tom R

customer_reviews.title: Not a replacement for the name brand
customer_reviews.text: Good cooler with lots of handy features. I bought it knowing it couldn't stack up against the leader in this segment but still not impressed with its performance. I got ice retention for two to three days max with this cooler inside a condo with the air set at 72 degrees. The regulat cooler I used last year for this trip worked just about as well. Still for the price it's a great cooler, just dont expect it to keep ice like the Y*ti.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: 5 days NO WAY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought This cooler to replace an igloo that is 10years old. My old cooler will hold ice for 48hrs during normal use in the back of my truck @95* no shade. Other brands at near box stores for this size cooler are 40$. @$99 I noticed This one had 5 day ice retention other brands with 5 days are $240+! So i took A chance. In the photos your looking at normal use on hot 90 degree days it lasted 48hrs ice turned to 40degree water NO ice left! By morning water was almost room temperature! i even Put the water bottles in the cooler from the freezer then added ice! I did This test 2x same result
customer_reviews.author: ncav34

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, but only 3 day ice retention.
customer_reviews.text: Great we'll made cooler, very good quality. It will only hold ice for 3 days (72 hrs). That's with only opening it twice in 72° weather, disappointed in the length it keeps ice, but 3 days is pretty good. I'm satisfied with purchase. Took one star away because of the length of time it kept ice. It's says 4 days on tags under 90° controlled conditions, so that is false. But if 3 days is good for you, this is an excellent cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hineman

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money - Pack it properly
customer_reviews.text: i have packed everything from adult beverages to meat to groceries in this cooler, and it does very well. I typically use large frozen packs on the bottom, then put the items I need cold/chilled/then more blocks on top. I like the bright color of the cooler, it makes it easy to see in the dark and it cleans easily as well. I cannot compare this to a rotomolded cooler like a Yeti or higher caliber cooler, but it does very well for around 1/3 of the price. I have had others buy a similar cooler after using this one and seeing how it performs. You will not be disappointed, just remember you need to pack it appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Angus

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I only received the cooler a few days ago, but it appears to be of decent quality. Not overly impressed with the thin plastic shell, but it's not a $400 yeti either. I'm going to do what one of the other reviews suggested and replace the handle bolts and apply a thin weather stripping to the under part of the lid around the seal for an air tight seal. I won't get to use it for 7 months so it will be sitting in a storage shed until Alaska spring. More updates will be provided in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska living

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Seems tough so far and hold ice well. Latches hold it firmly closed. I don't do any 3 day tests or anything but after 18 hours fishing in the Texas sun it still has it's ice, tha's all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ray

customer_reviews.title: So far, really good
customer_reviews.text: After extensive time researching other similar coolers, that were twice, three or four times this one's price, I went with it. I have not been disappointed. In the deep south, keeping items cool is a pretty big deal. With a family of four at the beach all day, or 8-10 hours of travel on the bed of a black vehicle with a black bed cover, I am not disappointed. It looks sharp, and keeps my items cold even after 8 or more hours with heat indexes over 100 degrees. The handles are sturdy, no issues with the hinges, seals well. Light when empty making it easier to transfer when full. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Billy J. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use on a cross country road trip. I have medications that need to be temperature controlled and cool. I tested it before we left and found that it needed a lot of ice to stay cool all day even inside an air conditioned house. So I froze a long bowl full of water to place in the bottom to help on the trip. It worked well enough, as long as I added fresh ice daily, but very little room left for snacks with all the ice.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle C

customer_reviews.title: A great cooler for the money
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for work, and often bring my own food with me, rather than eat fast food all of the time. This cooler is built well and holds ice well, but could be better. I haven't done actual tests comparing ambient temp to how many days the ice lasted, but did notice on my first trip that ice only held about two days. I then added a simple self adhesive rubber gasket from Lowes and encircled the top of the cooler opening. I now get about 1 1/2 more days out of my ice, so I am happy with the cooler for what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not a efficient as they say
customer_reviews.text: I think it is a great buy because of the price. Seems solidly build. I would buy it again. To say that ice stays for 4 or 5 days is not accurate. Camped in Michigan (not that hot) and needed to replace ice every two days. Better than a normal cooler but hardly what they say.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Patulski

customer_reviews.title: Get this
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion all coolers that are built beyond weekend use are overpriced for what is usually just a little extra foam. This cooler seems fairly well built and I consider it to be a good alternative to buying an extra overpriced cooler like a Yeti, unless you happen to need something bear proof? Just hang it in a tree. No gasket/does not air seal.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I have had many ice chest over the years. I have also seen many of the YouTube videos regarding ice retention. It all depends on where you live and the seasons when you will be using it. I personally have found that ice shape is very important. However, if you want ice to last the best thing is a solid block of ice. That's what I used for over a week of camping in my camper and the ice lasted the entire week. It work great and is now my ice chest of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great job of keeping supplies cold for a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 2 week trip through 5 states and many national parks. I may have added ice a few times and drained water but I had no problems keeping everything cold though varying temperatures from 108 through 33. It remained in the Jeep the entire trip. I initially froze the water bottles I was bringing along and they stayed frozen for the better of a week. Stay away from hollow ice that melts fast. Many stores now offer blocks that stay frozen for days. Seems rugged and sturdy and was easily secured with cords to the Jeep.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase we've made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this cooler. We often take road trips and took this cooler for its maiden voyage last week. It worked wonderfully. We used a recommendation from a previous review to freeze 6 or so 16 oz water bottles and use them as "ice" for the cooler. What a great idea! Even with those frozen bottles in there, we still had plenty of space for other drinks. And no mess from melted ice. I'd say we got around 48 hours of solid cooling before we would re-freeze the bottles. Not quite the performance mentioned in the product description, but totally fine for us at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: LEAKY DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: The drain hole on this cooler leaks. This problem didn’t arise until after the return window had closed. It keeps items cool for several days, and I think it would be a great cooler if it didn’t have this problem. I’ve tried to repair it a few times, but then the next day or two I come back to my car and the trunk is covered in water again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband. His last cooler was falling apart. He wanted a Yetti and I was searching for a smaller cooler. The reviews were poor on them and the prices to high for something that had mediocre reviews. I found this and saw the reviews and said why not. He was skeptical about it. This cooler is awesome we live in Florida and the heat is crazy. He leaves his cooler in his tailgate of his truck at all time. The ice lasts for days in it. The latches help it stay closed when he is driving down the highway.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Norton

customer_reviews.title: Solid and functional cooler.  Should be made in the US but isn’t.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice solid cooler. Functional and does the job just fine. Unfortunately, this cooler is not made in the US. I almost didn’t buy it because of that. Igloo, if you read these comments, bring the production of this cooler back to the US. Cooler: 5 stars Not made in USA: 0 stars Overall 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: Commercialphoto32

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler for Boats
customer_reviews.text: I have a Xpress 20 HB Bay boat which has room for a Big Fish cooler, but no place to put a drink cooler, This cooler fit right behind my captain seat and keeps drinks cold for a long time!! Love all the features and it's well built and at that price you can't beat it and it's the poor man's yeti!! A+++++++++ should of bought 4 at that price
customer_reviews.author: Danny Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Needs A Drain Spout
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great looking cooler. I read a number of reviews before purchasing it. A number of people didn’t like the fact that it comes with out a drain spout. I have to agree, it needs one. I had hoped it did a better job at keeping the ice from melting. That being said, it’s been over 100° degrees here for the past 3 days. Did I mention it’s a great looking cooler. If it had a drain spout I could have easily given it a 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: S. James Lin

customer_reviews.title: Igoo Ice Chest
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Igloo 52 quart ice chest because it had a guarantee to hold ice for 5 days. Reviews I saw were really good so I ordered one. I was to get something to hold ice for a period of time for our vacation. What a rip off!!!! It didn't hold ice for one day much less 5. We decided that instead of 5 days it meant 5 seconds. I am so disappointed because it was made by Igloo. Thank goodness my daughter brought a chest that held ice of a couple of days. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Ice Held Longer Than 72 Hours!
customer_reviews.text: We looked at comparable high priced coolers and were impressed with the look and the style. We purchased the Igloo cooler for a road trip into the mountains and used it along the way and during our stay there. My brother in law had a Yeti cooler that was comparable. The Igloo held up side by side and the ice lasted over 72 hours in my Igloo. The little drain plug on the side was so helpful, when the water filled, I was able to tilt and get rid of the water, which was able to preserve the ice even longer. I highly recommend the Igloo cooler for anyone looking for a great priced cooler comparable to the big names.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Frank Lind

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We got this cooler to act as a second fridge because we have such a small fridge in the RV. We are a block of ice to it and the next morning it is colder than my fridge. I then add party ice with whatever I want to keep cold and it typically stays cold with ice for up to three days. On the third day it starts to melt. It’s extremely sturdy and the handles are easy to use we had bought a different brand with the same handles and they were very difficult to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Lakisha

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the Hype
customer_reviews.text: I did my research against the Yeti, RTIC and Blue Cooler and choose the Igloo because of the price and the reviews . Some reviews said 3 days, some said 5 days. DON'T buy it. I put my cooler in a camper with AC running 24/7 and the ice lasts two days before all water. Disappointing. Great looking and obviously better built than a crap Rubbermaid/Coleman cooler but makes little difference when it comes to longevity of the ice. Still buying 20 pound bags basically daily.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Tire Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooler at a great price point
customer_reviews.text: Is this a Yeti cooler? No, it is not. Is it one-third the price of a comparable Yeti cooler? Yes, it is. The cooler does the job and doesn't look half-bad, although with the fake diamond plate I feel like they are trying a little too hard. IT has the features of a more expensive cooler. I'm hoping the rubber-like latches last a while, but other than that, seems very sturdy, and for me it is the perfect size, many coolers are too big for a weekend trip. Recommended for mid-sized coolers under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Spade

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Thought the inside would have much more space, returned it.
customer_reviews.author: LYKINS FAMILY

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. The lid doesn’t work well.
customer_reviews.text: The latches on the front pop off ever time the rubber latch is undone. Also the back screws all came out. The entire top of the cooler is cheap and doesn’t work. 2 days into my month long toad trip this cooler lid completely broke and was pieced together. It did keep stuff cold but getting into and closing the cooler was frustrating, I had to buy a different cooler as this one was no longer usable.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Why buy a Yeti, when you can buy this and save $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, very durable cooler. Hundreds of dollars cheaper than the Yeti or other "hey look at how much my cooler costs" brands, and works just as good!! (And won't get stolen first time you leave it out) The handles are thick and great grips for carrying a full load. The drain plug is well designed (you can even put a hose on it the run water away without having to move it) So glad I finally got one. 100% satisfied! I put one can inside and took a pic to show how big it is and how much it can hold ....
customer_reviews.author: PeonSanders

customer_reviews.title: you must check for the gasket
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful if you are buying this product used, or even new. There is a gasket that goes in the lid. Without it this product is completely useless. I order product used only because it arrived earlier but if I had not been familiar with the product and had taken it on my 4 day camping trip it would have been a disaster I would never forget, specially in the 95° heat we have right now. Make sure to check for the gasket upon arrival. Ps I just ended up buying from target, same day pick up.
customer_reviews.author: ShawT

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this model cooler (carbon) for a year and I love it. I got this cooler (green/orange) for a friends' birthday since he always comments on how much he likes mine. It was a big hit! It's a great design and heavy duty. Nothing overly fancy about it but it keeps beverages cold in the hot summer heat. Would highly recommend for those in need of a new cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So far I have not had any issues with this cooler. I have opened it up over 24 hours later and items still cold. Not ice cold but cold enough. It's also cool looking. I purchased on sale for under 60$ extremely worth the money. I purchased to take to the shooting range on long work days. This is perfect. Havent packed it full but I know it will hold multiple Tupperware dishes, 2 ice packs and 8 bottles of water with more room still available.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Love! I purchased 2 28q red flip top coolers the past 5 years, the lid wont stay attached for long with the hubbys line of work in construction. Irritating! I bit the bullet n purchased this one, which cost a little more money, but so far so good! Durable and is able to fit everything he needs for a 12 hour day! Plenty of large smartwater bottkes, gatorade, snacks and lunch! The real test will be this summer and see if he manages to keep it in tact!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Add more than one bag of ice.
customer_reviews.text: We boat this cooler specifically for the boat. It was about 85 today for the high. Left out late around 7pm for a trip down the river for dinner came back around 11pm. Only put 1 bag of ice in the cooler. I’m guessing if we put more than 1 it would of done better but there was a lot of water in the cooler when we got home. For the money it’s alright. Looks great but I’m guessing when out 90 degree days come it won’t last all day on the boat with ice. I’ll write another review in a month or so. Took pictures but don’t see where to submit them.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son at Christmas. He uses it for camping in the desert where they ride dirt bikes and driving sand rails. Did not hold everything for 5 days, but was good for at least 3 days and that was sufficient with the motorhome frig. Be careful with the drain plug, several other reviews said the cooler leaks, but it only does so if you don't keep the drain nuts tight. When unscrewing the cap on the drain, be sure to check the inside nut for tightness so that it doesn't become lose or it will leak slightly.
customer_reviews.author: DGraham

customer_reviews.title: Fair cooling power
customer_reviews.text: I throw ice packs in the cooler a day ahead of time to cool it down and help maintain the cooling properties. So far, the ice doesn't really last more than a few days...three tops. The days I've used this haven't been real hot and it's always in the shade. We always transfer the food to the fridge right away so it only cools some beverages. Maybe I'm not using enough ice...no idea but it's not holding ice as long as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: eyes N ears

customer_reviews.title: 5 days of ice -not likely
customer_reviews.text: Have had Igloo BMX cooler for several weeks now, well built but ice will not stay five days for sure, unless someone knows something that I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooler!
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty weird to be obsessed with a cooler of all things, but I am with this one. It’s the perfect size, awesome colors and style, and it does exactly what it claims to do. Keeps everything cold for a really long time and it’s definitely a durable cooler too that will undoubtedly last for years. I live in Florida and have left it in my car’s trunk without the ice melting for hours. I haven’t tried days yet, but I have no doubt this thing will hold up to that challenge too. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: THIS cooler DOES not HOLD ICE as it claims
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this cooler... I have tried it three different weekends...not even 90 degrees outside and the ice melts every afternoon... I missed the return date by two days, as I got home tonight to return it... I would love a refund... you can have the cooler back for sure... Lets see if customer service can get more than ONE star
customer_reviews.author: A. Raso

customer_reviews.title: 1/4  the price, almost all the performance
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is probably one of the best budget coolers out there. Ice lasts multiple days without any issues. The lid makes a nice solid seal. The cooler also has safety wire for the lid and the drain plugs so you will never lose wither if it came apart. You get like 70-85% of the performance that the top line roto formed coolers get but at 1/4 the price. Overall the construction and feel of the cooler is tough and rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Hamuel Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Tough and cold
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to store food for a camping trip. Because of space, we had to pack it on a trailer basket. It got covered in mud, but the lid never opened and the things inside were sealed away from the mess. We were only out there days, but we still had ice at the end. The locking latches were easy to use, but still secure. The handles and even the drain valve held up under heavy load, rough conditions and a lot of movement.
customer_reviews.author: K. Blocker

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping to use for my food for the weekend. It stayed in my Jeep for 3 days in 90° weather with the Jeep staying out in the sun and the ice barely melted. I added about a pound of ice on day 2 and that’s it. When not using for camping, I use it to store my phone while at work (phone not allowed inside building) and it keeps my phone from overheating in 100° with no shade. Awesome product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Ice for three days
customer_reviews.text: Amazon delivered this Igloo on August 24, 2020; while the temperature in the Inland Empire was hovering around 110. I loaded up with 7-9 lbs of Ice and kept in my work truck passenger seat all day. As I opened up my chest MULTIPLE times through the day it kept ice through Wednesday. (Every night I kept cooler inside my home) I paid $53 for this cooler and its doing a pretty god job. Though its kinda bulky and heavy when loaded up but the hinges, arm, and other parts seem to be made tough.
customer_reviews.author: HQ

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and go with this
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was researching different coolers to keep in my semi truck. I do have a mini fridge, but I wanted something for ice. I was ready to shell out several hundred dollars for the big name coolers, but decided to give this a try instead. Right off the bat, I filled it with a 20 lb bag of ice and it lasted 5 days. It could have gone one more day, but I decided to refill it. I'm so happy I saved my money and went with this Igloo.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the money, but im not sure about the claim for how long it hold ice
customer_reviews.text: Ill start this by saying i would absolutely buy again. I dont think there are many coolers under $100 of this quality. BUT i think the claims of how many days it holds ice is a bit overrated. Maybe if you packed it to the top with ice, but that leaves no room for food/drinks. I fill it halfway with ice and it lasts me 2-3 days
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Cool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of struggling with my existing lunch box/cooler. I already had a first class modern, hard shell, well insulated cooler. But it was just too small. This Igloo is anything but too small. It's really too big for a lunch box, and it's so sturdy that you might dent your bumper if you backed into it. ;-) Hauling it around is a pain, but man it keeps stuff cool, and it holds a lot. I could probably fit enough for three guys into the thing, but I'm not sharing.
customer_reviews.author: VPershing

customer_reviews.title: Drain Plug completely came out!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this less than a month and went to unscrew the drain cap and the entire drain componet came out. Now its a constant because I cant seem to get it tight enough on the backside(inside of the cooler) to stay together. Its so annoying! You have to reach inside the cooler and screw it all back together - really hard when theres ice in there!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money On This! Buy Rtic, Yeti or even Ozark Trail
customer_reviews.text: Four days of ice retention my ass! I put a twelve pack of bud light in this thing on Sunday night and by Tuesday morning it was nothing but water. If you’re going to make claims on your included paperwork make sure they’re true Igloo! The ice chest sat on a kitchen chair in my air conditioned 70 degree kitchen for two days while this was happening. So I guess this piece of crap is no better than any other Igloo cooler out there. #igloocoolers
customer_reviews.author: j. triche

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I used it recently over Memorial day for a 5 day trip. This cooler sat in the back of my 4Runner - hot Cali and AZ sun the whole trip. I had beverages in it with ice packs and some loose ice. I dumped out the ice and took my still solid ice packs out on the sixth day ... I figured the test was long enough. I am totally impressed. I have the 52 quart, because that was the easiest size to carry and fit in the back of our truck with other things. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Just some stuff I need!

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stays cold
customer_reviews.text: Interesting design. It's built to look like a rotomolded cooler, but is actually just a standard cooler. It advertises an ability to keep ice for 96 hours (4 days) , but this is likely only in super-optimal conditions (like pre-chilling, filling with majority ice, filled with chilled items). I took this out for a weekend trip, half filled with ice and half filled with drinks and all of the ice was melted in 2 days. Note that I was using it under "standard" conditions. Meaning I stuck cans and water bottles in there that were room temp, so my example is more to give you an idea of normal use situations.
customer_reviews.author: 100K

customer_reviews.title: Only one thing
customer_reviews.text: They did a beautiful job on trying to mimic the yetty version. Why not add a seal wth. I bought a seal for it so it will still end up being cheaper then the yetti at similar specs, but come on Igloo seals are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to keep things cold for days!
customer_reviews.text: We used this cooler to store ice in after a surgery. We took it upstairs and used “cooler shock” ice to keep the other items cold and both are an amazing combo. The cooler shock ice ( bought on amazon) stayed frozen more than three days. It was only beginning to get unfrozen at that time so I replaced them with another set. The only thing that would make the cooler better was if it had an extendable handle and wheels as it was pretty heavy even with nothing in it. Fantastic combo! Be sure to use cooler shock ice blocks too!
customer_reviews.author: Jana Morse

customer_reviews.title: A chest full of cold water after six hours
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on the advertised ability to keep things cold for days. Filled with cold bottled drinks and ice, closed and locked lid, and left in the shade on our porch for the afternoon. Came back to very cold drinks, very cold water, and very little ice. Cooler feels sturdy and easy to transport, but it just doesn't work as advertised. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Rogneby

customer_reviews.title: Almost a Yeti
customer_reviews.text: This cooler seems to be almost as good as a Yeti at about 1/4 the price. It's pretty well-built and definitely keeps stuff cold for long periods of time. I've only had it about a year, though, so cannot attest to long-term durability yet, but I would probably buy another one of these if it ever wears out, and I'd still end up saving a lot of money over buying a Yeti in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce F. Wilken

customer_reviews.title: doesn't have a drain
customer_reviews.text: I like this cooler, it keeps drinks cold for a long time, and it's beautiful. I only gave it 3 stars because it doesn't have a drain. It's not a deal breaker but it is inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Stroburg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't have the budget, nor did I want to spend a crazy amount on a popular brand cooler, so I went with igloo. Im glad I did. I love the design, and how it kept my drinks, and my dog's food still either half frozen, and still cold. ( Raw meats) I love the color too! Definitely recommend for a quick fishing trip, or a day trip to the lake :)
customer_reviews.author: KotaJane

customer_reviews.title: Works great, keeps ice for days
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Burningman, so 13 days in a desert. This would keep a couple bags of ice for 3 days, and a block of ice would last 4. Much better then the average cooler at this price point. We also had a yeti, and this worked just as well. My only thought, is that it doesn't have a gasket on the lid, it a tongue and groove, which I guess works, but if it's full of water and you carry it, it will slosh out. I might add a thin layer of silicon to help out with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Stellan Clark

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the crew in cold beverages all day!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put bottled water and pop in for my husbands work crew. It's a sturdy cooler, although a little bit heavy for me by the time I load it. I use freezer packs instead of ice, and after working outdoors in the sun all day, what's left in the cooler when it gets home is still cold. Definitely what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Iz B.

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler! I wanted to test it, so after filling it full of ice around 7:00am, I placed in the bed of my truck. 95 degrees, full sun, Florida summer! At 9:00pm day 1, I drained the water, 7:00am day 2, still had 3/4 of the ice! Still hot, full sun exposure all day. 9:00pm drained the water again. This time I didn’t tighten the cap. The next morning I still had half the ice left. Took over 5 days to melt all the ice. I’m going to test it again with bottled water and ice next. But I’m very happy with it. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: This is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't really afford one of the expensive, trendy Yeti coolers, and thought I would settle for this instead. I didn't settle at all. This cooler really does keep ice for three days. It is better than any other cooler I have ever used. When I go camping I always have a small cooler just for drinks, and found myself going to get ice every day. That is no longer necessary. I'm so please.
customer_reviews.author: Patty R.

customer_reviews.title: Good 25 Quart Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Good 25 Quart cooler. I used it for the first time on a two day camp out. Before I used the cooler I added a foam seal to the inside of the lid based on my experience with other coolers lacking a seal. For the trip I used two 1/2 gallon milk jugs filled with water and frozen solid as my ice supply. It was about 80F during the day and 65 at night. The cooler was opened to get beer or food about 15-20 times a day. After 72 hours there was still about a quart of ice in each 1/2 gallon jug and the last beer was still nice and cold.
customer_reviews.author: CHUCK

product_meta.title: Igloo BMX Family with Cool Riser Technology, Fish Ruler, and Tie-Down Points
feature_bullets: Heavy duty blow-molded construction with reinforced base for increased strength and protection.
Extremely durable yet lightweight with proven 4-5 day ice retention
UV inhibitors protect the cooler against sun damage for extended life.
Rust-resistant, stainless-steel hinge rods and hardware provide extended performance.
Rubberized T-grip latches keep lid secure.
MaxCold body with 20% thicker foam and insulated lid provide advanced cooling performance and up to 4-day ice retention.
Cool Riser Technology molded base elevates the cooler away from hot surfaces and improves cooling performance.
Comfort grip, 3-point-grab handle for easy one-handed carrying.
Built-in tie-down loops for securing cooler during transport.
Integrated ruler on lid easily estimates your catch.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
